be.thibaulthelsmoortel.helsmoortelUtil.util

Class Counter

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.thibaulthelsmoortel.helsmoortelUtil.util.Counter

  • public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing basic and advanced counting features.
    Author:
    Thibault Helsmoortel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ERROR__RESET 
      static java.lang.String ERROR_COUNT 
      static java.lang.String ERROR_MAX_VAL 
      static java.lang.String ERROR_MIN_VAL 
      static java.lang.String ERROR_VAL 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Counter()
      Default constructor.
      Counter(int count)
      Constructor to create a counter that starts from a set count.
      Counter(int count, int hop)
      Constructor to create a counter that starts from a set count and to set the size of hops.
      Counter(int count, int hop, int minVal, int maxVal)
      Constructor to create a counter that starts from a set count, to set the size of hops and to set minimum and maximum counter values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float currentPosition()
      Returns the current position of the counter as a percentage (where minVal = 0% and maxVal = 100%).
      void decrement()
      Decrements the counter (with the set hop value).
      void decrementBy(int amount)
      Decrements the counter with a given value (hop not used).
      int decrementByThenGet(int amount)
      Decrements the counter with a given value (hop not used) and returns the new count.
      int decrementThenGet()
      Decrements the counter and returns the new count.
      int distanceToMaxVal()
      Returns the distance from the current count to the maximum value.

      Returns the distance from the current count to the minimum value.

      Returns the minimum value of the counter.

      Returns the count and decrements it later.

      Returns the count and decrements it with a given value (hop not used) later.

      Returns the count and increments it later.

      Returns the count and increments it with a given value (hop not used) later.

      Increments the counter with a given value (hop not used).

      Increments the counter and returns the new count.

      Resets the counter to its initial count (0 by default).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Counter

        public Counter()
        Default constructor. Puts the initial count on 0 (like a regular Integer), the hop on 1 and minimum and maximum values of Integers.

      • Counter

        public Counter(int count)
        Constructor to create a counter that starts from a set count.
        Parameters:
        count - the count to start from

      • Counter

        public Counter(int count,
               int hop)
        Constructor to create a counter that starts from a set count and to set the size of hops.
        Parameters:
        count - the count to start from
        hop - the default in- or decrement value

      • Counter

        public Counter(int count,
               int hop,
               int minVal,
               int maxVal)
        Constructor to create a counter that starts from a set count, to set the size of hops and to set minimum and maximum counter values.
        Parameters:
        count - the count to start from
        hop - the default in- or decrement value
        minVal - the minimum value of the counter
        maxVal - the maximum value of the counter

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns the current count.
        Returns:
        the current counter value

      • setCount

        public void setCount(int count)
        Sets the count to a specific number.
        Parameters:
        count - the new counter value

      • getInitialCount

        public int getInitialCount()
        Returns the initial count.
        Returns:
        the initial counter value

      • setInitialCount

        public void setInitialCount(int initialCount)
        Sets the initial count. Useful for the reset() method.
        Parameters:
        initialCount - the initial counter value

      • getHop

        public int getHop()
        Returns the default in- and decrement value.
        Returns:
        the default in- and decrement value

      • setHop

        Sets the default in- and decrement value.
        Parameters:
        hop - the default in- and decrement value

        public int getMinVal()
        Returns the minimum value of the counter.

        Sets the maximum value of the counter.
        Parameters:
        maxVal - the maximum value of the counter

      • setMinAndMaxVal

        public void setMinAndMaxVal(int minVal,
                            int maxVal)
        Sets the minimum and maximum values of the counter.
        Parameters:
        minVal - the minimum value of the counter
        maxVal - the maximum value of the counter

      • increment

        public void increment()
        Increments the counter (with the set hop value).

        Example: count = 5; hop = 1 (default hop value) After method execution: count = 6 (similar to count++!)

      • decrement

        public void decrement()
        Decrements the counter (with the set hop value). Example: count = 5; hop = 1 (default hop value) After method execution: count = 4 (similar to count--!)

      • incrementThenGet

        public int incrementThenGet()
        Increments the counter and returns the new count.
        Returns:
        the count after incrementing

      • decrementThenGet

        public int decrementThenGet()
        Decrements the counter and returns the new count.
        Returns:
        the count after decrementing

      • getThenIncrement

        public int getThenIncrement()
        Returns the count and increments it later.
        Returns:
        the count before incrementing

      • getThenDecrement

        public int getThenDecrement()
        Returns the count and decrements it later.
        Returns:
        the count before decrementing

      • incrementBy

        public void incrementBy(int amount)
        Increments the counter with a given value (hop not used).
        Parameters:
        amount - value to increment the counter with

      • decrementBy

        public void decrementBy(int amount)
        Decrements the counter with a given value (hop not used).
        Parameters:
        amount - value to decrement the counter with

      • incrementByThenGet

        public int incrementByThenGet(int amount)
        Increments the counter with a given value (hop not used) and returns the new count.
        Parameters:
        amount - value to increment the counter with
        Returns:
        the count after incrementing

      • decrementByThenGet

        public int decrementByThenGet(int amount)
        Decrements the counter with a given value (hop not used) and returns the new count.
        Parameters:
        amount - value to decrement the counter with
        Returns:
        the count after decrementing

      • getThenIncrementBy

        public int getThenIncrementBy(int amount)
        Returns the count and increments it with a given value (hop not used) later.
        Parameters:
        amount - value to increment the counter with
        Returns:
        the count before incrementing

      • getThenDecrementBy

        public int getThenDecrementBy(int amount)
        Returns the count and decrements it with a given value (hop not used) later.
        Parameters:
        amount - value to decrement the counter with
        Returns:
        the count before decrementing

      • distanceToVal

        public int distanceToVal(int value)
        Returns the distance from the current count to a given value.
        Parameters:
        value - value to check the distance from
        Returns:
        the distance from the current count to the given value

      • distanceToMinVal

        public int distanceToMinVal()
        Returns the distance from the current count to the minimum value.
        Returns:
        the distance from the current count to the minimum value

      • distanceToMaxVal

        public int distanceToMaxVal()
        Returns the distance from the current count to the maximum value.
        Returns:
        the distance from the current count to the maximum value

      • currentPosition

        public float currentPosition()
        Returns the current position of the counter as a percentage (where minVal = 0% and maxVal = 100%).
        Returns:
        the current position of the counter as a percentage (where minVal = 0% and maxVal = 100%)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the counter to its initial count (0 by default).

      • resetTo

        public void resetTo(int count)
        Resets the counter to a new value (does not change the initial count).
        Parameters:
        count - the new counter value to reset the counter to

      • resetTo

        public void resetTo(int count,
                    boolean initCount)
        Resets the counter to a new value. If the second parameter is true, the initial count will be changed to this new value (if false, it doesn't).
        Parameters:
        count - the new counter value to reset the counter to
        initCount - flag indicating whether to set the initial count or not
